column4: hi everyone, i need to make a script to connect via ssh to my remote server, dump my database and close the connection and finally end the script. However when i run the script i can see that i am connected to my ssh server but i need to type all the rest to dump the database and close the connection. There is obviously something i need to add to the script to execute all commands. Can anyone help?
what for? what is the final goal?
you want to retrieve the dumped db zt home, correct?
i need to put the script into cron and dump my file everyday or whenever i want
do i need to elaborate more on that?
no. the first sentence was not that elaborate, now we know what you want to do
A script obviously behaves differently than a konsole prompt. Do you know what i need to add to the code to make all commands after the "ssh bla bla bla my_server" ?
i meant  make the rest of the commands execute
if you can wait I may be able to retrieve something I put in place on a server to do exactly what you want to do
just need time to search for it
i do something similar with ftp command via script
what makes the difference is that at the end of the first line i have to add "<< EOT" and also at the last line of the code
if i do not add the "<< EOT" only the first line executes
i tried the same with ssh but it doesn't work
i think i got it please do not bother
